briefdescription.para: Enum defining implemented continuous boost distributions.
Kernel type that is used in the Kernel Density Estimate.
Pointer to Kernel Density distribution class.
Typedef for shared-pointer to SimpleLinearRegression object.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::VectorXd &vectorOfData)
memberdef.name: computeAverageOfVectorComponents

briefdescription.para: Compute average of the components of a vector.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the average (arithmetic mean) of the components of a vector.
vectorOfData
Vector containing data to be averaged.
Average of data in vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::VectorXd &vectorOfData)
memberdef.name: computeStandardDeviationOfVectorComponents

briefdescription.para: Compute standard deviation of the components of a vector.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the standard deviation of the components of a vector.
vectorOfData
Vector containing data to be averaged.
Standard deviation of data in vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< double > &sampleData)
memberdef.name: computeSampleMean

briefdescription.para: Compute sample mean.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes sample mean based on the following unbiased estimator (Spiegel and Stephens, 2008): \[ \mu_{s} = \frac{ \sum_{i=1}^{N} X_{i} } { N } \] where $\mu_{s}$ is the unbiased estimate of the sample mean, $ N $ is the number of samples, and $ X $ is the sample value.
sampleData
Sample data.
Sample mean.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Eigen::VectorXd > &sampleData)
memberdef.name: computeSampleMean

briefdescription.para: Compute sample mean for a sample of VectorXd.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes sample mean for a sample of VectorXd based on the following unbiased estimator (Spiegel and Stephens, 2008): \[ \mu_{s} = \frac{ \sum_{i=1}^{N} X_{i} } { N } \] where $\mu_{s}$ is the unbiased estimate of the sample mean, $ N $ is the number of samples, and $ X $ is the sample value.
sampleData
Sample data.
Sample mean.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< double > &sampleData)
memberdef.name: computeSampleVariance

briefdescription.para: Compute sample variance .

detaileddescription.para: Compute sample variance.

Computes sample variance based on the following unbiased estimator (Spiegel and Stephens, 2008): \[ s^{2}_{s} = \frac{ 1 }{ N - 1 } * \sum_{i=1}^{N} X_{i} ( X_{i} - \bar{ X } )^{ 2 } ) \] where $ s^{2}_{s} $ is the unbiased estimate of the sample variance, $ N $ is the number of samples, $ X $ is the sample value, and $ \bar{ X } $ is the sample mean.
sampleData
Map containing sample data.
Sample variance.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< double > sampleData)
memberdef.name: computeSampleMedian

briefdescription.para: Compute Sample median.

detaileddescription.para: Computes the median of a set of data samples. (Montgomery, D. C. & Runger, G. C. Applied statistics and Probability for engineers Wiley, 2014)

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Eigen::VectorXd > &sampleData)
memberdef.name: computeSampleVariance

briefdescription.para: Compute sample variance for a sample of VectorXd.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes sample variance for a sample of VectorXd based on the following unbiased estimator (Spiegel and Stephens, 2008): \[ s^{2}_{s} = \frac{ 1 }{ N - 1 } * \sum_{i=1}^{N} X_{i} ( X_{i} - \bar{ X } )^{ 2 } ) \] where $ s^{2}_{s} $ is the unbiased estimate of the sample variance, $ N $ is the number of samples, $ X $ is the sample value, and $ \bar{ X } $ is the sample mean.
sampleData
Map containing sample data.
Sample variance.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::VectorXd &sampleData, const unsigned int numberOfAveragingPoints=5)
memberdef.name: computeMovingAverage

briefdescription.para: Compute moving average of vector.

detaileddescription.para: Compute moving average of an Eigen vector.

Compute moving average of vector, where the moving average is computed by sliding a window of the specified length along the data. Note that since the window is centered at the current element, the window size (numberOfAveragingPoints) has to be odd.
sampleData
Vector of sample data.
numberOfAveragingPoints
Number of points (including the center point) to be used to compute the moving average. Needs to be an odd number.
Vector containing the moving average of the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Eigen::Vector3d > &sampleData, const unsigned int numberOfAveragingPoints=5)
memberdef.name: computeMovingAverage

briefdescription.para: Compute moving average of a set of Eigen vectors in a STL vector.

detaileddescription.para:
Compute moving average of a set of Eigen vectors in a STL vector.
sampleData
Vector of sample data.
numberOfAveragingPoints
Number of points (including the center point) to be used to compute the moving average. Needs to be an odd number.
Vector containing the moving average of the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::map< double, Eigen::VectorXd > &sampleData, const unsigned int numberOfAveragingPoints=5)
memberdef.name: computeMovingAverage

briefdescription.para: Compute moving average of a set of Eigen vectors in a map.

detaileddescription.para:
Compute moving average of a set of Eigen vectors in a map. The moving average is computed by first combining the map values into a matrix, and then the moving average along each row is taken. Note that since the computeMovingAverage function is used, the window size (numberOfAveragingPoints) has to be odd.
sampleData
Map of sample data.
numberOfAveragingPoints
Number of points (including the center point) to be used to compute the moving average. Needs to be an odd number.
Map of data after moving average is applied.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ContinuousBoostStatisticalDistributions boostDistribution, const std::vector< double > &parameters)
memberdef.name: createBoostRandomVariable

briefdescription.para: Function to create a random variable class of BoostContinuousProbabilityDistribution type.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a random variable class of BoostContinuousProbabilityDistribution type, which links random variable interfaces of this architecture to implementations from boost.
boostDistribution
Type of distribution of which a random variable class is to be generated
parameters
Free parameters of requested distribution (for instance mean and standard deviation for Gaussian distribution, see implementation for order of parameter, if relevant)
Random variable class of BoostContinuousProbabilityDistribution type

memberdef.argsstring: (const int numberOfSamples, const std::vector< std::shared_ptr< RandomVariableGenerator< double > > > randomVariableGenerators)
memberdef.name: generateRandomSampleFromGenerator

briefdescription.para: Generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, distributed.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, distributed according to probability distributions provided as input. Size of each sample is define by size of vector randomVariableGenerators.
numberOfSamples
Number of samples that are to be generated.
randomVariableGenerators
Probability distributions for the entries of the random vectors (i.e. entry i of this vector is distribution of entry i of each sample).
Set of samples according to given distribution settings.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int numberOfSamples, const int numberOfDimensions, const std::shared_ptr< RandomVariableGenerator< double > > randomVariableGenerator)
memberdef.name: generateRandomSampleFromGenerator

briefdescription.para: Generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently and identically distributed.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently and identically, distributed according to probability distribution provided as input.
numberOfSamples
Number of samples that are to be generated.
numberOfDimensions
Size of each sample.
randomVariableGenerator
Probability distribution used for each of the entries of the random vectors.
Set of samples according to given distribution settings.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int seed, const int numberOfSamples, const Eigen::VectorXd &lowerBound, const Eigen::VectorXd &upperBound)
memberdef.name: generateUniformRandomSample

briefdescription.para: Generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, uniformly distributed.

detaileddescription.para: Generator random vector using pseudo random generator.

Function to generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, uniformly distributed. The size of each sample is defined by the size of the lowerBound and upperBound vectors (which must have identical size).
seed
Seed of random number generator.
numberOfSamples
Number of samples that are to be generated.
lowerBound
Vector of lower bounds for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors (i.e. entry i of this vector is lower bound for distribution of entry i of each sample).
upperBound
Vector of upper bounds for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors (i.e. entry i of this vector is upper bound for distribution of entry i of each sample).
Set of samples according to given distribution settings.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int seed, const int numberOfSamples, const int numberOfDimensions, const double lowerBound=0.0, const double upperBound=1.0)
memberdef.name: generateUniformRandomSample

briefdescription.para: Generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently and identically uniformly distributed.

detaileddescription.para: Generator random vector using pseudo random generator.

Function to generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently and identically uniformly distributed.
seed
Seed of random number generator.
numberOfSamples
Number of samples that are to be generated.
numberOfDimensions
Size of each sample.
lowerBound
Lower bound for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors
upperBound
Upper bound for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors
Set of samples according to given distribution settings.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int seed, const int numberOfSamples, const Eigen::VectorXd &mean, const Eigen::VectorXd &standardDeviation)
memberdef.name: generateGaussianRandomSample

briefdescription.para: Generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, Gaussian distributed.

detaileddescription.para: Generator random vector using pseudo random generator with gaussian distribution (without correlation)

Function to generate sample of random vectors, with entries of each vector independently, but not identically, Gaussian distributed. The size of each sample is defined by the size of the lowerBound and upperBound vectors (which must have identical size).
seed
Seed of random number generator.
numberOfSamples
Number of samples that are to be generated.
mean
Vector of mean values for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors (i.e. entry i of this vector is mean for distribution of entry i of each sample).
standardDeviation
Vector of standard deviations for the distributions for the entries of the random vectors (i.e. entry i of this vector is standard deviation for distribution of entry i of each sample). *
Set of samples according to given distribution settings.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int seed, const int numberOfSamples, const int numberOfDimensions, const double mean=0.0, const double standardDeviation=1.0)
